data.title: Nice place but expensive
data.text: We took the kids for dinner because they wanted mudbugs. We got mild and well they didn't have any flavor at all. The waiter brought us butter and so powder spice. And again it didn't have any flavor. The kids enjoyed it but for the price I was pretty disappointed.

data.title: real cajun
data.text: The atmosphere is not very fancy, but the food is always good quality. I have had the cajun boil and the fried catfish and fried crawfish. It has always been fresh and tasty.

data.title: Nice Family Luncheon
data.text:
This bar significantly change my opinion abour American bar. We initially thought that we will see an American Cowboy with hat and boots, on the contrary we saw many of Texan's family who choose this bar for their lunch time.

It wasn't a luxury place but quite comfortable for family luncheon. My wife and I really enjoy our lunch at Crawdaddy's while waiting for The greyhound bus which located around 30 feet from this bar.

data.title: First visit
data.text: First time eating here, gotta admit nice enviornment. You can even eat or drink looking at a aquarium instead of looking at the tv. Staff was welcoming to everyone who walked inside, food was decent not bad not great.

data.title: Raw oysters and boiled crawfish - yum, yum
data.text: As the title says, that's what I had.  Both were very good.  The oysters were a little small, but they had great flavor.  The boiled crawfish and sausage platter was good.  I ordered the crawfish the hottest of their 3 spice choices and was eagerly anticipating a lip burning experience, but the lack of heat in the spiciest level was disappointing to me.  That being said, however, I would definitely go back again.

data.title: Yummy!!!
data.text: Super fresh and the flavors are on point! Closest to Louisiana crawfish over ever had and the service was great! Thank you crawdaddy's!!!

data.title: Limited Menu but very delicious
data.text: Not the biggest menu but everything they have is delicious. Cold beer, good food. Nice atmosphere. Great service.

data.title: Not worth the money
data.text: Came wanting some good Crawfish and seafood boil..shrimp was the best thing we ordered. We ordered spicy. The Crawfish you could tell were frozen not fresh..coming from Houston this place was just ok..and they ran out of gumbo..

data.title: Best cajun seafood in town
data.text: This restaurant has the best Cajun seafood and I highly recommend it, my husband & I eat there at least once per month.

data.title: HUGE SHRIMP
data.text: The food was super good with perfect seasoning. Good waitstaff..I could not believe the size of the shrimp definitely HUGE..

data.title: Crawfish Boil!
data.text: Went for the crawfish,  was not dissapointed!!  Hole in the wall,  great,  fresh crawfish boil served right on the table!  Ice cold beer!! Friendly staff!

data.title: Great times
data.text: Me and my mother enjoyed the crawdaddys here. The service was good our waitress gave us some info on places to check out. The food was awsome.

data.title: Absolutely excellent crawfish!
data.text: My daughter did the research to find this place while we were visiting Corpus Christi.  It is a little hole-in-the wall place that doesn't look like much - but you walk in the front door and there's a juke box playing and the food is to die for.  We had the 'Feast"  - must have been two pounds of crawfish, sausage, corn-on-the-cob, potatoes - and a couple of pitchers of beer,  Loved it.  Highly recommend that any visitor to Corpus Christi make a plan to visit Crawdaddy's.  Service was excellent, too.

data.title: Just loved the place
data.text: Just around the corner from my hotel was this little gem. I loved it as it was not pretentious, just good food and very popular with the locals. One of the dishes that you can order is the Full Cajun or the half Cajun. This was a mixture of Crayfish, hot sausage and loads of other wonderful stuff. I had a job managing the half Cajun. The full Cajun would defiantly feed the masses.

data.title: What happened????
data.text: This used to be the best place in town to go on a Tuesday night for all you can eat crawfish....but what happened?? Two weeks ago....had to wait for 45 min between plates being served...service was terrible and finally left. Last night upon arrival at 4:30 ( as it's always been) we were told that no crawfish would be served until 6:30 and that if we wanted a table we would have to wait 2 hours to be served. Waitress said that not enough crawfish was ordered and to make it fair to all customers...whether they got there early or not, they wouldn't serve until 6:30...SERIOUSLY???? Who is the manager here? The place was a mess when we arrived and we only saw two employee's. Other customers that arrived early as well also had real complaints !!! Did this place sell to new management?? Never going back!!!!

data.title: Crawdaddy's Restaurant, Corpus Christi, Texas
data.text: Walked about two blocks to this restaurant from the Holiday Inn Marina in Corpus Christi, Texas.  From the outside, I was a little hesitant but decided to try them anyway. Was met by a friendly staff and seated quickly.  This is certainly not a fancy place, but the food was very good. I will say though it was a little pricey. Menu is Cajun.  Would I eat there again. Probably yes.

data.title: Pleasantly surprised.
data.text: I had a take away lunch from here with reluctance. Colleagues were going, and I read a few reviews that weren't so good. So I chose to play it safe. I ordered the chicken strip meal with new potatoes and unbreaded fried okra. Their chicken strips had a tasty peppered batter and some yummy dipping sauces. The potatoes were perfectly cooked and it was great to have okra without the breading. While I didn't have their specialty cajun dishes, I was pleasantly surprised.

data.title: yum
data.text: Awesome food, great ambiance. Pricey for a family but the food is superb!!!!!! service is good and variety is good. tshirts are cute. Live music is fun!

data.title: Just awful
data.text: My husband and I stopped in for lunch.  I had the seafood gumbo and the boudin.  Boudin was nothing special, I have had the same from HEB.  Seafood gumbo was inedible.  I am not a big complainer, but I just couldn't stand it.  My husband had red beans and rice and was not happy either- he dumped half a bottle of pepper on it and managed to get through half.  The crackers (typical Premium brand) were totally stale.   Service was ok.  We won't be going back.

data.title: Great crawfish and sausage.
data.text: We used to frequent the other location, which was more of a restaurant than a bar, but it has since closed.  We have been to this location a few times, which is more a bar than anything with minimal seating for diners.  This is one of the only places in town that you can get crawfish, and it serves its purpose for that.  I usually come for the all-you-can-eat crawfish, which is expensive at $25, but I love crawfish so it's worth it on occasion.  The crawfish are smaller, but cooked perfectly and the seasoning is just out of this world.  In fact, we buy their seasoning and always keep it on hand at home and use it in almost everything.  You can buy it at the bar.  The sausage that comes with the crawfish is juicy and perfectly cooked.  The go-to, and only choice for the crawfish lover in Corpus Christi.
